author: cryptofly777
title: Cardano Casino
description: Cardano has a strong community but lack fun social spaces outside of Twitter. Social gaming can strengthen community ties & friendships.

f6_assessments.q0: The Cardano Casino aims to integrated social aspects into traditional card & casino games. The proposal could potentially bring the mass adoption of Cardano although the market size of online gamers haven't been specified. Although the proposer specifies this is not a "run of the mill" game creation, the proposal hasn't identified the differentiation between NFT and FT and its function as a buy-in to access the room. Also the FT will be distributed freely to delegators within the pool of proposer might raise the question as to what is the criteria for allocation and whether this would be accepted by the game platform users.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has not provided any references or links to the team member profile. Also the budget breakdown has not taken into account of 6 possible team members with 1 plutus dev (as a possible hire). The other cost is stated to come out of proposer pocket. The proposal budget of 50k has no traceability. The timeline suggests that the proposer know well about the resources needed to accomplish the project but hasn't provided enough proof to back up the proposal. Despite the fact that the large work has been carried out for the project, there is also no link for the project. The proposal will improve if the proposer can supply more information in detail with breakdown cost and profile of the team.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer has specified the KPIs to measure the project progress in the form of completion of various aspects of the game. It has clear understanding of how to bring gamers to be on-chain with the usage of casino games. However, some area of solution is unclear and unexplained. The lack of references (website or links on the card artwork, FT or even the community the proposer claims that those components are ready) makes the project losing its credibility and its ability to address the challenge.

f6_assessments.q0:
From my first glance at this proposal, my initial reaction was fascination since I haven’t come across the idea of bringing cryptocurrency tokens into the world of casinos. There have been many games which simulate the atmosphere and functions of a casino, but they mostly utilize their own in-game tokens which cannot be traded into any real-world currencies. Therefore, an idea should be attractive enough to call in the attention of players, which, if successful, shall align comfortably with the objective of this challenge. The proposer also offers a brief but efficient description of how the NFTs in the game would function, and lists out a number of possible issues to the project, followed by a rather vague resolution. 
What I find as shortcomings in this section, however, are those followed:
The proposer hasn’t specified exactly whether the Cardano-based casino will operate the same as those in real life or will it have any different operating features?
The proposal doesn’t include some key metrics to measure what initial success to this project will look like. For example, an estimated user base, and given the proposer claims to put in use large amounts of NFTs, is there a specific number of some sorts?
f6_assessments.q1: According to the provided plan and timeline, I would say that the execution process of this project is plausible and should guarantee to deliver its end results on time, though I could always need a starting date or mark. I must say it’s admirable of the proposer to handle a generous number of expenses on his own, and the requested budget will only be for paying the developers, though I would advise the proposer to provide a specific number. The record of team members are quite sufficient with the positions needed and relevant experience. Nevertheless, I feel like this section would benefit greatly from the addition of affiliated website links or LinkedIn profiles to further verify each member’s capabilities.
f6_assessments.q2: From my aspect of this section, I believe the team hasn’t succeeded in providing a method of progress tracking just yet, but rather a listing of milestones for the project. Therefore, I suggest adopting the use of tracking tools such as ClickUp, Trello or GitHub for public access as well. Nevertheless, its envisioned success includes the mass adoption of this project in particular and Cardano in general, which I believe sits comfortably with the main objective of the Gamers On-Chained challenge

f6_assessments.q0:
From the results section of the proposal, we can see that the proposal can align with the challenge. The game will require large amounts of NFTs for use and will attract many people into the Cardano ecosystem when there is a low barrier to entry into the game.
The game description is a bit short for the reader to understand the game. The author can add more illustrative parts and add more detailed features of the game.
Currently, the proposal is quite lacking in risk analysis and solutions, but only mentions the status of the project. I think it would be better if the risks for the next steps were considered even if only steps of the platform building, coding, and bug identification remained.
f6_assessments.q1:
The roadmap of the project is presented quite clearly, However, I think it would be better to be able to clearly note the timeline next to the available timeframe such as: Game creation, testing and in-game art creation will require approximately 2 months: from ... to...
Besides, in terms of the budget, if there is a detailed description of the payment of developers are to be used, the expected completion time, and the corresponding cost, it will be easier for the community to assess the feasibility of the project.
In addition, I think descriptions of the work process, featured products and reference links should be added to the team member part so that the information on this section can be easier to evaluate.
f6_assessments.q2:
I find the proposal is missing some pretty important information to evaluate the auditability.
The descriptions of roadmap milestones to define successful projects, as well as ways for the community to monitor and evaluate have not been mentioned. The success of the project is quite general, and it is difficult for the community to determine whether the project has achieved its goals or not. The author should add quantitative indicators of the amount to be completed with a specific time, how results are reported, and how (tools are used) to evaluate project progress. This makes it easier to measure and evaluate the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
Firstly, i don't see the team has addresses the problem that is the source of the solutions they are working on but after reading the whole proposal, I reckon that the idea of the team is enhancing and adding some more functions for most of casino games? In that case, I will give my opinion toward that ideas. It’ll help a lot if you can state your problem in the beginning though. 
I think this proposal addresses the challenge. To be honest, I’m very impressed with the resources that the team has been working before hand and bring it into the project. This proposal walks through the solution of having more functional casino games, connecting players with each other and with the ecosystem. It seems the team has already had such a great preparation to start this project and some of  hence they can foresee the problems/risks that they might encounter in the future, and with a solid and well cared for foundation, I believe that they can overcome them.
f6_assessments.q1: For the feasibility, the team deserves praises for such a detailed timelines. This plan effectively aligns with your idea and you have drawn a clear path to walk on. I also want to give a plus point for your estimated time of allowance for delays and overruns. It’s a very careful and necessary step but I have not seen it being such a thing in other project. To me, it doesn’t mean the team is not confident but they are very cautious with this project and surely want to give the best to players. However, I do expect to see a budget breakdown as detailed as your timeline so I suggest the team should add more information of budget and funding here and in the beginning part of this proposal
f6_assessments.q2: With the auditability, I imagine that since the team has already started building some resource for this project, they surely have a clear vision of what success looks like. After reading the whole proposal, I can have some ideas of some function in my mind after the project is launched. However, to effectively measure the success, I would like to see some more numbers, for instance, how many percentages of the increase of the adoption of the platform from users outside Cardano that you expect after a certain amount of time. In my opinion, some details like that will help people have a better overall look with this project.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer has included information of the project, about its functions and features. They wrote directly and in an easy way for people to understand. The proposal even pointed out that the project would have a wide appeal and adoption within the Cardano space. However, the proposed solution to address the challenge they came up with seemed not clear enough to align with the challenge’s key metrics. About the risks in the future, they seemed not so worried about them because of the strong developer team that they have.
f6_assessments.q1: The plan and timeline for delivering the solution was written pretty well, we can see what the team is going to do and for how long. The tasks were given out pretty clear. But the budget needed to be more detailed. I personally think that they need to give the more detailed number, the better readers or sponsors can understand. So that they would know if it is suitable or not. About the team members who take charge of the work, it was mentioned in the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer has listed what they need to do to measure their progress. However, I think it would be better if they could put particular time or any number to make a target to follow easily. They have pictured what the success look like. As I read the proposal, I would make a guess that this might not be their first proposal for the challenge, or it was even funded before, but they didn’t mention anything if it’s an entirely new one or not, so I think they needed to be more careful and make this clear.

f6_assessments.q0: a big applause for the team on giving an extremely understandable game functions. There is no doubt that gambling always has its own attraction and the team is making it more enjoyable, convenient and player friendly by all of the connection plans for players. I am especially into the translating function that helps the players to make friends. The using of NFTs and FTs can help increasing the demand and be a part of aligning the challenge setting. The team also have good plan to attract new players by giving available free room. In order to further encouraging word-of-mouth spread, I suggest the team to have rewards or promotions for old players that introduce new ones to join the community, or put some affiliate marketing strategies with the influencers, whose contacts are already earned by the team members. Another suggest is running tournaments and having them lived stream, audiences can use NFTs or FTs to access and watch it, and they can also donate for their favorite players too. For all the reasons above, this proposal has the potential to meet the KPI of the challenge. However, I would like the team to give more metrics to measure the possibilities of the project or how this proposal will align with the challenge exactly. It is good to know that the project is completed partially and already has FTs minted to the value of 50 million, means that the team is facing real risks and having experiences on solving those. I would like to have more details on the problems and solutions to ensure the trustworthy issue of this proposal. To be specific: What is the risk? How come the solutions? How long will it take to solve it? Who will be the one that in charge for different problems? Etc. For the potential this proposal owns, I will give it a 4 over 5 on Impact.
f6_assessments.q1: the team comes up with effective plans and timelines, it is a clear and easy to follow process. Although, we will need the detailed budget along with each stage of the project. The team required the fund for hiring developers without the predicted amount or expected salary from developers. Please provide step by step of the project, what to do, who in charge, and is there any KPI or target to maintain the project? Moreover, we will need the developers information included with some projects that they have experienced (Linked In profiles or names with tittles and companies that the developers worked at will be necessary). It is very thoughtful of the proposal owner that we can keep a lower risk by paying himself/herself for servers, promotion, NFT distribution, further developer payments, etc. But as far I am concerned, how about the other departments? Like marketing or PR team, or game designers? Please give us more budget metrics to consider. You guys earn 2/5 on feasibility.
f6_assessments.q2: it seems to me that it is a great idea to have Charles Hoskinson joining the project, we can attract not only gamers but also crypto people. Notwithstanding, this is just a preliminary plan, we will need the specific plan included clear metrics and number to scale the KPI and target. Otherwise, it will be hard for us to know how to maintain the project and how to review the success of it. As stated above, the team already have previous NFT project, please attached the project information so that we can have a better look at the possibility of this Cardano Casino proposal. I will give a 2/5 on this, hoping to see an improvement for this project.

f6_assessments.q0: There are serious problems with this proposal.  While the concept is very good, there is no solid information whatsoever to support the narrative of the applicant.  They are requesting a large amount of funds but do not provide any information that specifically addresses anything contained within, instead leaving nothing but generalizations.  Based on the total lack of solid information handing out tens of thousands of dollars is not recommended.
f6_assessments.q1: While the proposer claims to have considerable relevant experience and connections, they have included no information whatsoever on anything they have done.  Broad generalizations do not inspire confidence.  Team members are referred to in generic terms such as "Python and javascript developer" with no indication of who they are or what they have previously accomplished.  This complete lack of specific information needs to be rectified.
f6_assessments.q2: No realistic timeline, no breakdown of where funds will be spent and what the results will be, nothing specific of any kind.

solution: A platform with traditional card & casino games with an integrated social aspect. Bringing many existing NFT communities into one place.
experience:
NFT developer & community builder since the Mary hardfork.
I have specialised in creating communities & connecting the right people with the right projects.
Artist with proven track record over multiple mediums.
I come with a team of competent developers with Cardano experience.
